meanings.definition: A type of flowering plant with tuberous roots and showy, often fragrant flowers.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the cyclamens added a splash of color with their beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: I bought a pot of cyclamens to brighten up my living room.
meanings.sent3: The cyclamens in the flower bed seemed to be gossiping about the tulips.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like a cyclamens in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals of the cyclamens danced in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: The plural form of cyclamen, referring to multiple plants of this type.
meanings.sent1: The cyclamens in the greenhouse were thriving under the care of the gardener.
meanings.sent2: She received a bouquet of cyclamens as a thank-you gift.
meanings.sent3: The cyclamens at the flower shop were having a party to celebrate spring.
meanings.sent4: The field of cyclamens looked like a sea of pink and white waves.
meanings.sent5: The scent of the cyclamens filled the room with a sweet fragrance.
